newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvia Saules Bank '96 profit dips, eyes bourse.
newsitem.headline: Latvia Saules Bank '96 profit dips, eyes bourse.

text.p: Latvian commercial bank Saules Bank said on Wednesday that its 1996 profits fell to 866,000 lats from 1.48 million lats the previous year and said it was interested in getting a stock market quote.
Saules has just sold 20 percent of its shares to Tallinna Pank from neighbouring Estonia, which became the second Estonian bank to enter the Latvian market after Hansapank.
Saules board member Yuri Shchetinin and Tallinna Pank vice-chairman Targo Raus were quoted in a joint statement as saying that a bourse quote for the Latvian bank was possible.
"Shchetinin and Raus consider that the next step for Saules Bank should be its entry to the stock market," the statement said.
"In the current situation, it would be appropriate to expect this to happen during 1997," the statement added.
Saules said its assets rose to 50.04 million lats during 1996 from 33.83 million lats at the end of 1995 and that its share capital gained to 5.77 million lats from three million lats.
